recursive subroutine dfs(to, current_color, parent_node) result(()) 

    implicit none

    integer, intent(in) :: to, current_color, parent_node
    ! ...
    ! This function modifies the 'ans' array and variables when used.

    ! Iterate through edges in the g(to) list.

    type(Edge), dimension(:), pointer :: edges_here
    integer :: i_edge, k, e_id, e_to
    integer :: edge_count_to

    edges_here => g(to)%list ! Associate the edges for this node's list.

    edge_count_to = size(edges_here)

    k = 1

    do i_edge = 1, edge_count_to

        ! Access each edge in edges_here's list.

        e_id = edges_here(i_edge)%id
        e_to = edges_here(i_edge)%to

        if (e_to == parent_node) cycle ! Skip the parent node.

        ! Now, process this edge.

        ! First, check if k equals the current_color (which is the color of the edge that brought us here)
        ! We must choose a color for this edge that is not the same as current_color.

        if (k == current_color) then
            k = k +1
        end if
        
        ans(e_id) = k

        ! call DFS on e_to with parent as 'to', and color k (this edge's color, since the edge that connects to the next node is the opposite edge, which shares the same id)

        call dfs(e_to, k, to)

        ! increment k to choose next possible color
        k = k + 1

    end do

end subroutine dfs
